conclusion: To solve this problem, we need to calculate the average velocity and average speed of the particle.
The particle moves along two semi-circular arcs, each with a radius of 1 meter, from point A to point C, taking 5 seconds.
The displacement x is the straight-line distance between points A and C.
The displacement can be calculated using the Pythagorean theorem.
Since the radius of each semi-circle is 1 meter, the distance from A to B (or B to C) is the hypotenuse of a right triangle with legs of 1 meter each.
The average velocity v is the displacement divided by the time taken.
The average velocity v = x / t = sqrt(2) / 5.
The average speed v_s is the displacement divided by the time taken.
The average speed v_s = x / t = sqrt(2) / 5.
Since the average velocity and average speed are the same, the average speed is sqrt(2) / 5.
The average velocity of the particle is sqrt(2) / 5 meters per second, and the average speed is also sqrt(2) / 5 meters per second.
